snippet: Beijing’s effort to limit information on the Hong Kong protests has been met by clever ways of expressing dissent.
abstract: Politically-minded web users in mainland China are attempting to outmaneuver government censors who have been working to scour social media of photos and news about continuing demonstrations in Hong Kong; users are posting pro-democracy remarks on nonpolitical websites and uploading selfies of shaved heads in solidarity with protesters.
lead_paragraph: Beijing’s effort to limit information on the Hong Kong protests has been met by clever ways of expressing dissent.

headline.main: Chinese Web Censors Struggle With Hong Kong Protest
headline.print_headline: Censors and Protesters Tangle on the Web
